b9af7051-03c3-4595-88ca-a1825112ece4.name: Adam McNeilly
b9af7051-03c3-4595-88ca-a1825112ece4.bio: Adam is a Software Engineer, Android enthusiast, and pun aficionado. He fell in love with Android when he picked it up as a hobby in 2013 and he's been staying on top of the latest trends and contributing to open source projects ever since. Adam also strives to be an active member of the developer community - traveling the world to attend and speak at hackathons and conferences to both educate and learn from others in the community.

464fd6c7-2ecb-48cf-8f9d-c82bb160cb5f.name: Akshay Mukadam
464fd6c7-2ecb-48cf-8f9d-c82bb160cb5f.bio: A passionate android developer who loves to build simple and beautiful apps. When all done you will find me either cooking delicious Indian cuisines  and cheering for Liverpool FC

6e75d5a7-6616-4fe1-8681-a4a78db7b62e.name: Alex Zhukovich
6e75d5a7-6616-4fe1-8681-a4a78db7b62e.bio: Alex Zhukovich has been developing Android since 2011. Currently, he is working in Takeaway.com. He is a public speaker and software enthusiast with a passion for technologies, which share thoughts & experiences on the private technical blog at http://alexzh.com and YouTube channel: bit.ly/AlexZhYouTube

4f6d2a24-eb80-46df-bf6b-09af7c915c73.name: Alizée Lambert
4f6d2a24-eb80-46df-bf6b-09af7c915c73.bio: Alizée est consultante UXUI chez OCTO Technology. Après un rapide détour par l’UX research, elle co-construit aujourd’hui avec ses clients et leurs utilisateurs des applications mobiles et web dans des secteurs variés (énergie, secteur publique, startups…). Passionnée par les problématiques d’expérience utilisateur en mobilité, elle suit de près les évolutions sociales et techniques afin d’imaginer des expériences toujours plus intuitives.

f3facba0-c34d-4c87-a7e7-a81a67c8029d.name: Antoine Danois
f3facba0-c34d-4c87-a7e7-a81a67c8029d.bio: Antoine is an Android Developer at Citymapper based in London. Before that, he worked at Canal+ in Paris. When he's not working to help people catch their buses in big cities, he's watching videos of rockets and space related things, also his desk is named "Legoland" by his colleagues. Part of the Droidcon London Program Committee, and organiser for GDG London, he's doing his best to have amazing conferences in London, because the community is really important in the world of Android. And otherwise, he's just eating cheese.

9b593465-3930-4605-8f4d-4dacc490a7e5.name: Antoine Gerard
9b593465-3930-4605-8f4d-4dacc490a7e5.bio:
Ingénieur logiciel chez Syntony GNSS, passionné d'informatique et de trucs de nerds. Fan de Kotlin et toujours friand de Java.

Développeur Android depuis quelques années, j'ai exporté mon savoir d'Android en dehors du monde de l'agence afin de travailler avec des chercheurs en GNSS et plein de formules mathématiques. J'explore des coins du framework Android uniquement cités dans des papiers obscures de Google Scholar.

Software Engineer at Syntony GNSS, complete computer enthusiast and like nerdy stuff. Kotlin's fan and still a Java lover.

Android developer for several years, I exported my Android knowledge outside of the agency world for working with GNSS reasearchers which require a lot of mathematical formula. I explore sides of the Android Frameworks that are only quoted in niche Google Scholar's papers.

66fbb80a-cd18-4ba1-931d-d070d060ab95.name: Arnaud Giuliani
66fbb80a-cd18-4ba1-931d-d070d060ab95.bio:
Software developer for more than 13 years. Since a while now, I work as mainly as a Senior Android developer and keep hands in backend stuff. I'm working with Big companies as well as with startups. I'm a speaker since 2016. I talk mostly about Kotlin, Android & Koin. In 2017, I've created Koin (https://insert-koin.io), a lightweight dependency injection framework for Kotlin.
I joined BlaBlaCar mobile team in 2020.

10659767-356c-4cd5-ba9c-12cec7a3ce79.name: Ash Davies
10659767-356c-4cd5-ba9c-12cec7a3ce79.bio: Google Developer Expert for Android, enthusiastic speaker, lead engineer at ImmobilieenScout24, Kotlin aficionado, spends more time travelling than working (he/him)
10659767-356c-4cd5-ba9c-12cec7a3ce79.shortBio: Lead Android Engineer at ImmobilienScout24 GmbH

96b5b534-e4ad-4cc9-99c9-0bb194633d16.name: Benjamin Gonin
96b5b534-e4ad-4cc9-99c9-0bb194633d16.bio: Benjamin est développeur Android, il travaille actuellement chez Lalalab. Fanboy Android depuis 2011, il a commencé à travailler dans des agences, chez Kartable, puis SeLoger avant cela.

2bc1e95f-1243-4ad0-8a11-75541fee10e0.name: Carlos Mota
2bc1e95f-1243-4ad0-8a11-75541fee10e0.bio: Android team lead at WIT Software, he can easily be spotted there working on the company RCS solution. An enthusiastic for new technology and always trying to reach those last 20% of all of his side projects that seem to be really far away, he loves to share his knowledge with others either by giving talks, teaching, writing or along with a cold beer in the nearest pub. GDG Coimbra organizer and Kotlin evangelist, he also has a huge passion for travel, photography, space and the occasional run.
2bc1e95f-1243-4ad0-8a11-75541fee10e0.shortBio: Lead Software Engineer at WIT Software

9716ff27-d78b-437f-9ce8-24087a771ccc.name: Clément Garcia
9716ff27-d78b-437f-9ce8-24087a771ccc.bio: I started to work on my first Android apps on Froyo and Gingerbread during my studies and now, after spending some time at a digital services company and a few years in a connected objects startup, I am leading the Android team at Heetch: a ride-sharing French startup operating in Europe and Africa that has adopted a remote-first culture from the very beginning of the company.

3e135478-0ce2-4d41-bf3a-bdd7ff29d554.name: Csaba Kozák
3e135478-0ce2-4d41-bf3a-bdd7ff29d554.bio: Csaba leads development of Android projects at Supercharge. His role is to take part of planning, designing, choosing the best architecture for projects, and leading sizeable Android teams during the whole process of development. He also optimises the company’s code review, continuous integration and testing workflows. Csaba is passionate about open source: he was contributing to several high-impact projects related to Android development, including the Android Framework source code itself, and he was the lead developer of the popular GitHub library, AndroidAnnotations.

2e5f6d59-ad04-4d16-a6d7-d9c61aa7304c.name: Daniele Bottillo
2e5f6d59-ad04-4d16-a6d7-d9c61aa7304c.bio: Daniele Bottillo is an Android engineer working at Deliveroo in London. He's been developing apps on mobile web, iOS and Android platforms since 2010. Previously at TransferWise, ASOS, Blinkbox and YoYo wallet.

a34985cc-f276-4f1a-ba53-db86d084fe93.name: Divya jain
a34985cc-f276-4f1a-ba53-db86d084fe93.bio: I am a mobile developer, currently enhancing the Gametime App and enjoying exploring San Francisco. I have been learning and building Android apps since more than 2 years now.  I am always up for a new challenge and want to create awesome mobile apps with the purpose to make life fun and easy and solve problems. If I am not coding, I am usually traveling or lost in my other world of fictional novels.

7c888e22-f254-4e04-aa56-1853ab18c000.name: Elaine Dias Batista
7c888e22-f254-4e04-aa56-1853ab18c000.bio: Elaine has been working with mobile apps development for the past 6 years. Since the launch of the Google Assistant, she has been following the developments around that area. She truly believes that interacting with technology using natural language will define the future of computing. Born and raised in Brazil, she's been living in France since 2004 and loves everything multicultural. She's a GDE for the Google Assistant.

b8e52efe-7709-4af8-8e97-cb07860b8e24.name: Enrico Bruno Del Zotto
b8e52efe-7709-4af8-8e97-cb07860b8e24.bio: After several years working like a mobile consultant, Enrico moved to London working as lead developer @Smartfocus.com developing an indoor positioning system based on beacons. Since May 2017 working @ TUI.co.uk where he's creating the next generation of mobile travel app for TUI customers.

878ec0bb-f4d7-4b83-a9af-ff6e359a35dc.name: Etienne Caron
878ec0bb-f4d7-4b83-a9af-ff6e359a35dc.bio:
Etienne Caron is a Staff Developer at Shopify, a popular Canadian e-commerce company. He is also part of Google's Developer Expert program, and an instructor for Caster.io

Etienne has been an active member of the Android developer community in Montreal since 2010, and regularly contributes time to mentoring startups, developers and students in the mobile space.

00697e34-7c28-4e6d-a5dc-271203984645.name: Eyal LEZMY
00697e34-7c28-4e6d-a5dc-271203984645.bio:
- Treasurer at the Paris Android User Group
- Co-organizer of Android Makers in Paris
- Google Developer Expert

I've been working with Android since 2009. I took part of several R&D projects at french internet providers, then at Samsung in the Android B2B team, I also built an Android set-top box for a hotel chain, worked several years on Genymotion, an Android emulator. Then I joined Qonto a French B2B bank to build their Android app and I recently joined TAG Heuer to build their connected watches and ecosystem.

0b1323da-2946-49de-be5c-e54d44e12325.name: Fabien Devos
0b1323da-2946-49de-be5c-e54d44e12325.bio: After about a decade of building mobile apps and games at Facebook and various startups in Paris, London and San Francisco, Fabien took over the Android, iOS and Web teams at Wealthfront, a fintech startup in Silicon Valley.  He also co-created Hacked, a mobile coding game with more than a million downloads.
0b1323da-2946-49de-be5c-e54d44e12325.shortBio: Director of Mobile and Web Engineering at Wealthfront

2e93a5e7-2037-4d7d-a548-7512f9c14960.name: Fabio Collini
2e93a5e7-2037-4d7d-a548-7512f9c14960.bio:
Fabio Collini is a Google Developer Expert for Android and Kotlin. He started Android development in 2009, first as a freelance with two apps on Play Store and then as a developer for some companies and startups. Now he works as a remote engineer in the Android team at the New York Times. He is one of the authors of the second edition of Android Programmazione Avanzata, an Italian book dedicated to some advanced aspects of Android development.
He is a co-owner and writer for the Italian blog CodingJam and he publishes articles about Android and Kotlin on his medium profile.
2e93a5e7-2037-4d7d-a548-7512f9c14960.shortBio: Android Engineer at The New York Times

0b65f68e-972b-41de-ae7a-92a2f77893c3.name: Florian Mierzejewski
0b65f68e-972b-41de-ae7a-92a2f77893c3.bio:
Software engineer with a strong mobile background.
I’ve worked for widely different clients in various countries, on an even wider range of projects. From greenfield to enormous untested legacy codebase, I’ve seen glory and horror while always managing to have a positive impact. Eternal learner, you’ll always find me with a book, listening to a podcast or at a local meetup to improve what I know or discover something I don’t. TDD, clean code, best practices, pair programming but also empathy and compromise.

a16b8efa-a150-45bc-b4e6-243583659c26.name: François Blavoet
a16b8efa-a150-45bc-b4e6-243583659c26.bio: François  works on the Android app at Instacart. He has a good experience getting his hands dirty on the dark corners of Android's UI stack since the ListView days.

12f64022-4a11-46a9-9bf2-91da26b6839f.name: Gabriel Adgeg
12f64022-4a11-46a9-9bf2-91da26b6839f.bio:
Développeur Android depuis 8 ans, je suis sensible aux enjeux environnementaux, sans être pour autant fortement impliqué. 
J'aimerais profiter de ce talk pour partager avec vous quelques réflexions que je ne prends en considération que depuis trop peu de temps.

6b8f27b2-f4f8-4dcb-92e7-0381ae87ad85.name: Garima Jain
6b8f27b2-f4f8-4dcb-92e7-0381ae87ad85.bio: Garima Jain, Android GDE, also known as  @ragdroid is working as an Android Engineer at Over. Previously she has worked with Fueled Noida and Bharti Soft Bank (Hoppr, Hike). She is also an international speaker, CasterIO author and an active technical blogger.

78ffd2f4-e52a-4a7d-8ead-8cf072843946.name: Geoffrey Métais
78ffd2f4-e52a-4a7d-8ead-8cf072843946.bio: Lead Android developer at VideoLAN and Videolabs

6520ad1e-8c4e-45c1-b34d-91ca73db27fe.name: Gerard Paligot
6520ad1e-8c4e-45c1-b34d-91ca73db27fe.bio:
Technical Leader Android des outils mobiles collaborateurs en magasin chez Decathlon depuis 2 ans. Je travaille sur l’architecture logicielle de l’ensemble de nos applications mobiles.

Réel passionné du développement Android et membre du GDG Lille Android, je co-anime le Lille Android User Group depuis 2018.

e11a53fd-1cfb-4930-9dfa-42187e94d869.name: Hadi Tok
e11a53fd-1cfb-4930-9dfa-42187e94d869.bio: Hadi Develops Android Applications since Android 1.6 Donut and very passionate about it. Developed a handful of Android applications since then with a variety of technical challenges. I also like to try new things. He developed software for other platforms professionally and personally. Hadi likes to share his experiences so he is writing blog posts in Turkish and English. He is really active in community slack channels to help people out and get helped. He also gives talks about Android development mostly about Kotlin related subjects. Hadi loves to learn new things and share them with people.
e11a53fd-1cfb-4930-9dfa-42187e94d869.shortBio: GDE on Android, Lead Android dev at Citizenme

cb9da4e8-c687-4231-96e7-f0e594fe7f5d.name: Helen Adekoya
cb9da4e8-c687-4231-96e7-f0e594fe7f5d.bio: Helping teams deliver high-quality, reliable, app releases on a defined regular cadence.

2d41d3fb-3321-4b47-a401-ae84a5de2423.name: Huyen Tue Dao
2d41d3fb-3321-4b47-a401-ae84a5de2423.bio:
Huyen Tue Dao is an Android developer and Google Developer Expert for Android and Kotlin. She currently works on the Trello Android app at Atlasssian and is also co-producer of the "Android Dialogs" YouTube channel.

Huyen lives in Denver, CO though is often found in the DC Metro area. When not up late programming, she is often found up late gaming (video, board, card, anything).

0ef1e55b-29b9-4c4b-938d-c59b6c8ea9d3.name: Jamie Adkins
0ef1e55b-29b9-4c4b-938d-c59b6c8ea9d3.bio:
Jamie is an Android Developer at Pulselive, and was the Android lead on the Cricket World Cup 2019 app.

Before Pulselive, Jamie was building CTS tests for Project Tango.

b3770b77-c9c8-454d-8b7a-045ca1d66b7b.name: Jeroen Mols
b3770b77-c9c8-454d-8b7a-045ca1d66b7b.bio:
Jeroen Mols is a Google Developer Expert (GDE) in Android, the former lead Android developer at Philips Hue and an internationally recognized speaker. With a passion for complex systems and highly technical apps, Jeroen has helped realize four connected products and over 15 Android applications.

Experienced in leading large teams, he can step beyond his developer role and provide technical leadership to others. He continuously challenges the status quo and mentors people surrounding him to grow. Shipping apps to millions of users, Jeroen has a thorough understanding of both the Android framework and how maintainable software should be crafted.
b3770b77-c9c8-454d-8b7a-045ca1d66b7b.shortBio: Android Developer at Plaid and GDE

a7d0fcec-49dd-4e65-bcb7-ad3d1901928c.name: John Hoford
a7d0fcec-49dd-4e65-bcb7-ad3d1901928c.bio: John is a developer on Android working on Android Studio, ConstraintLayout and MotionLayout. He has worked on Android Studio, RenderScript, Vector Drawables, computed shadows and photo editor filters.

c03a7211-54ff-4819-9789-1a22ed91fafc.name: Jossi Wolf
c03a7211-54ff-4819-9789-1a22ed91fafc.bio: Jossi is an Android Developer at Snapp Mobile. Jossi graduated high school in 2018 and has been working on many projects, including software for startups as well as car manufacturers. As a GDG Organiser and part of Women Tech Makers Hamburg, he is working on a project bringing coding classes to schools using several new approaches. Jossi also loves Kotlin and Rabbits!

462e6b97-01f9-44b1-864c-9d85bedf911b.name: Julien Salvi
462e6b97-01f9-44b1-864c-9d85bedf911b.bio:
Into the Android development since Froyo when Fragment was just a myth, former Android engineer at CINEMUR, I am currently working at InnovOrder as Senior Android Engineer where we are bringing restaurants to the next level.
Besides that, I am a world traveler and a beer lover always looking for the best IPAs!

eb5cd092-73fa-402d-8636-8a52574e74c3.name: Kai Koenig
eb5cd092-73fa-402d-8636-8a52574e74c3.bio:
I am a Software Solutions Architect specialised in web and mobile technologies using client-side platforms such as mobile web, Flutter and Android. 

Another focus of my work is building and the integration with JVM-backend platforms such as Java, Kotlin, CFML, Lucee and others like Go and Python. I spend most of my work time contributing to projects of various clients and sizes, fulfilling the role of an architect, principal developer, consultant or mentor/instructor.
eb5cd092-73fa-402d-8636-8a52574e74c3.shortBio: I build stuff for Android and have 4 chickens! :)

9c90fc80-8166-4e7a-975c-5b4321000659.name: Martin Bonnin
9c90fc80-8166-4e7a-975c-5b4321000659.bio: Martin has been crafting strongly typed software since Android 1.5. After streaming a whole lot of videos in all kind of weird multimedia formats, he's looking lately into strong typing his API requests with GraphQL and automate everything so he can relax more!

305ca7a0-8158-45a6-8bbf-10f6ad55ef18.name: Martin Devillers
305ca7a0-8158-45a6-8bbf-10f6ad55ef18.bio:
Developing mobile applications since 2014, in Paris and Chicago. Arrived at Dashlane in 2017 and quickly convinced the Android team that Kotlin is the most beautiful language in the world. Passionate about software design.

Recovering Starcraft addict. Also loves the outdoors.

1916ae1c-96d7-480f-9eed-bf5dce444441.name: Márton Braun
1916ae1c-96d7-480f-9eed-bf5dce444441.bio: A Kotlin enthusiast since the 1.0 of the language, writer, speaker, educator. Software Engineer at Skyscanner. Android/Kotlin Tech Editor at RayWenderlich.com. Instructor at BME-VIK, teaching Kotlin and Android. Ranked right around the very top of the Kotlin tag on StackOverflow. Creator of the MaterialDrawerKt and Krate libraries.

89694c9d-5de0-4f39-a50a-ed48d6eb56ca.name: Nelson Osacky
89694c9d-5de0-4f39-a50a-ed48d6eb56ca.bio: Former Square in San Francisco, now working at Soundcloud in Berlin

ed1e4545-4547-4697-9515-28f4174f09dd.name: Nicolas Roard
ed1e4545-4547-4697-9515-28f4174f09dd.bio: Nicolas works on the Android Studio Design Tools and the ConstraintLayout library at Google

3e5fddb1-d6ae-42af-8f79-a3c0b61b0892.name: Nishant Srivastava
3e5fddb1-d6ae-42af-8f79-a3c0b61b0892.bio:
Nishant is an Android Engineer based in Berlin, Germany. He is an open source enthusiast who spends his time doodling when not hacking on Android, while also being a caffeine-dependent life-form. He can be found either talking about android libraries or advocating that coffee is the elixir of life at community gatherings. He has experience in Android SDK Engineering, Firmware Engineering and Audio Digital Signal Processing(DSP) on Android.

He has been part of 3 startups in the past, ranging from being the Founding team member at OmniLabs, Inc.,  being the First employee at Silverpush for whom he developed the company’s patented UAB (Unique Audio Beacon) Technology to being an Android Engineer at Soundbrenner where he dabbled in the art of Firmware Engineering a bit for their custom wearable product, Core while managing their Android application.

d3841a2b-b09c-41f7-afa6-26734c05a277.name: Paulina Sadowska
d3841a2b-b09c-41f7-afa6-26734c05a277.bio: I work as an Android Developer at Allegro, largest online marketplace in Poland. Loves to share knowledge through public speaking and blog posts.

a0eaa66e-1b5f-4b90-a2c8-0e50472971b8.name: Pierre Benayoun
a0eaa66e-1b5f-4b90-a2c8-0e50472971b8.bio:
Engineer since 2001, I worked for 10 years for major clients such as Thales and Cdiscount.
I have been developing on Android since 2011.
I developed applications on my own and won a contest at Sosh.
I am the author of the Badass framework that I use for my personal applications.
I have also worked on mobile security solutions for major accounts such as Deutsche Bank.
Since July, I have been working at Deezer in Bordeaux on Android projects to be tested on new markets.

b8647805-eaff-4885-929f-513d5f1ee728.name: Pierre Crepieux
b8647805-eaff-4885-929f-513d5f1ee728.bio: Passionné par les télécoms, cela fait une quinzaine d'années que j'évolue dans ce domaine au sein d'Orange. Après m'être concentré sur le développement de serveurs avec des technos comme H.323, IMS, Réseau Intelligent, je suis passé de l'autre coté du réseau pour faire du développement Android. Aujourd'hui, je cultive et m'appuie sur cette double expérience pour investiguer les problèmes qui se posent à la frontière entre les deux.

2f909cb1-ca6f-4e25-8442-f67cdc7f2b5c.name: Pierre Tibulle
2f909cb1-ca6f-4e25-8442-f67cdc7f2b5c.bio: CTO chez Ikobox, je gribouille des sketchnotes colorées et avec le temps qu'il me reste je participe à l'organisation du meetup Android Nantes (GDG)...

0f359408-c439-4f1b-986b-f8344d6d60e0.name: Quentin Metzler
0f359408-c439-4f1b-986b-f8344d6d60e0.bio: Android lead developer writing code between the Alps and Lyon when he's not running in the mountains.

75a99392-2d32-4632-9d9b-a70bb700365c.name: Raul Hernandez Lopez
75a99392-2d32-4632-9d9b-a70bb700365c.bio:
I am originally from Valencia (Spain), but so far I've lived in Belgium and for a while now in London (UK).

I consider myself a continuous learner, very enthusiastic about the Android platform & Kotlin language specifically.

I work as a Senior Software Engineer at Twitter, and I've participated in both Periscope and Twitter Android apps, being the Technical lead on Dynamic delivery for Twitter Android.

2553ba47-e51c-42c6-b7b5-1136d927eca2.name: Rémi Dormoy
2553ba47-e51c-42c6-b7b5-1136d927eca2.bio: Développeur mobile chez OCTO Technology, Rémi est très intéressé par les problématiques de design et de parcours utilisateurs, il travaille au jour le jour à développer des applications Android fluides et agréables dans différents secteurs comme la banque ou la recherche d'emplois.

4674e36f-50f8-4ffb-a486-679d730c759e.name: Renaud Mathieu
4674e36f-50f8-4ffb-a486-679d730c759e.bio: Android Software Engineer based in Paris. Renaud likes sharing return of experience on how to develop Android apps. Renaud used to work at Captain Train, Viadeo and Parrot and is currently building NEOS that will change the way customers will pay in any shop.

0b98f2d1-1e2f-4ea7-81b7-6a0d0d700112.name: Richard Bogdan
0b98f2d1-1e2f-4ea7-81b7-6a0d0d700112.bio:
8+ year’s experience in Software Development industry. Started as Android developer and worked as Scrum Master. 
Worked a lot in security-related topics, for the last several years in Fintech and now at Bitrise. I like quality products and forward-thinking.

933caffb-2f12-49f0-b438-fcb1e0c6562b.name: Romain Menetrier
933caffb-2f12-49f0-b438-fcb1e0c6562b.bio: Founder @Emblock, proud PAUG member since many years, many experiences as CTO & innovation manager.
933caffb-2f12-49f0-b438-fcb1e0c6562b.shortBio: Founder @Emblock, proud PAUG member since many years, many experiences as CTO & innovation manager.

adadf66f-529c-48fd-ba12-94903187a216.name: Salih Guler
adadf66f-529c-48fd-ba12-94903187a216.bio: Salih is a Berlin based Senior Mobile Engineer who is a Google Developer Expert for Flutter and Dart. He likes sharing his knowledge with the people by mentoring aspiring developers, blogging and talking at conferences.

c3226ef8-4784-4a3c-a83d-6b70c0dcde1d.name: Sandra Dupré
c3226ef8-4784-4a3c-a83d-6b70c0dcde1d.bio: Sandra is an Android developer for Disney Streaming Services. Subteam lead on DIsney+, she works to give the best UI and animation to the Disney+ users.

e397fee8-078f-4694-8a1f-35b1d57f1fce.name: Sebastiano Poggi
e397fee8-078f-4694-8a1f-35b1d57f1fce.bio:
Emerging from the foggy plains of northern Italy 🇮🇹 after working at a smartwatch startup, Sebastiano moved with his curls to London 🇬🇧 💂 to do great things at AKQA and then Novoda. 

Regularly speaking at conferences and brain-dumping on the 'net got him into the Google Developers Experts programme in 2014. Nowadays he's working on some rather cool Kotlin stuff for JetBrains.
e397fee8-078f-4694-8a1f-35b1d57f1fce.shortBio: Software Engineer at JetBrains; GDE for Android, Flutter and Identity

783383ee-7b06-415a-9e72-a46a21bb3e92.name: Siddhant Panhalkar
783383ee-7b06-415a-9e72-a46a21bb3e92.bio: Software Engineer, passionate about how to make efficient and performance centric applications. Keen on learning new things everyday.

f8c30c09-8132-4ac8-91a5-9e7b293063a4.name: Thomas Ezan
f8c30c09-8132-4ac8-91a5-9e7b293063a4.bio: Thomas is an Android Engineer. For the past 4 years he has been in Lyft’s Growth team. He is currently based in Seattle, WA.

22971f2f-e773-4c71-a767-4e0cf49d0e04.name: Vincent Nicolle
22971f2f-e773-4c71-a767-4e0cf49d0e04.bio: Développeur dans le mobile depuis plus de 20 ans, passionné par les nouvelles technologies. A rejoint Coyote System en 2010 en tant que développeur multi-plateformes (iOS/Android).
22971f2f-e773-4c71-a767-4e0cf49d0e04.shortBio: Coyote System, Lead Software Engineer Mobile

bf58d77f-fad3-49b7-a6b3-82b5f46e5549.name: Xavier F. Gouchet
bf58d77f-fad3-49b7-a6b3-82b5f46e5549.bio: Xavier F. Gouchet is a Senior Software Engineer at Datadog, experienced public speaker, and proud father. Passionate about open source, testing and architecture, he has been dabbling in Android since the Cupcake days and has been working as a professional Android engineer since 2012.

0cc865f0-2d9d-479d-b247-181ff5b8357a.name: Xiaoyi Li
0cc865f0-2d9d-479d-b247-181ff5b8357a.bio: Xiaoyi is an Android engineer working at Dashlane with years of experience. He is focusing on building the best password manager, providing the most smooth UX and the best security solution for millions of users.

8ce6cf3a-735e-4a2a-b05f-e2081e5b6741.name: Zac Sweers
8ce6cf3a-735e-4a2a-b05f-e2081e5b6741.bio: Zac is a mobile engineer with primary focus areas in Android, code gen, Kotlin, OSS, and avoiding sniffly APIs. He’s the creator of a few open source projects like AutoDispose and CatchUp, and active contributor to several more.

e862a78f-9664-4f80-9f3f-2eea47aa7fcb.name: James Barr
e862a78f-9664-4f80-9f3f-2eea47aa7fcb.bio: James is a software engineer focusing on Android, UI & design systems, Kotlin, and large code migrations. He’s currently working on Eats at Uber, with previous work at Imgur, Two Toasters, and BlackBerry. In his spare time, James enjoys running, biking, go karting, and attending NASCAR races.

a733fc42-dcb9-4107-9675-70335f2889e9.name: Pierre-Yves Ricau
a733fc42-dcb9-4107-9675-70335f2889e9.bio: Android Tech Lead @Square, author of LeakCanary & AndroidAnnotations, killer of fragments.🍷🥖⛷🇫🇷

2f06b856-2d7e-4062-b595-d4a01623c34d.name: Taylor Ling
2f06b856-2d7e-4062-b595-d4a01623c34d.bio:
Taylor Ling is a Digital Product Designer and passionate about great digital product experience, as well as closing the gap between design and development. He co-founded and designed Fabulous, a scientific habit-forming companion that received Material Design Award from Google in 2016.

Before Fabulous, he worked in an international 3D printing company on their life-saving medical software for surgeons. He also worked at a software solution house in Kuala Lumpur called Snappymob and crafted Saved, an award-winning iOS financial tracker app.

453b89b2-b526-4c8d-87cb-de95a31cc311.name: Vincent Barthélémy
453b89b2-b526-4c8d-87cb-de95a31cc311.bio: Vincent Barthélémy joined MWM 5 years ago to build an ecosystem of music applications. Since the first edition of AndroidMakers, the whole MWM Android team has attended the event with a Maker stands. Every year, they build little demo apps to promote the audio features of the Android SDK, discuss with the attendees of the new possibilities offered by the last Android version.
453b89b2-b526-4c8d-87cb-de95a31cc311.shortBio: Head of Android Team at MWM

2bcd8543-a998-48c9-8cbf-e03f9b17ff83.name: Lorica Claesson
2bcd8543-a998-48c9-8cbf-e03f9b17ff83.bio:
Lorica is a UX Designer with a twist, having both a design and technical background.

She is passionate about innovative desktop, web and mobile applications that are tailored for real users. Designing engaging and easy-to-use interfaces backed up by a solid technical understanding of what is feasible and using a range of methods for understanding what users really want and need.

Lorica works as a UX design consultant in Switzerland, specializing in mobile design, with a seemingly rare interest for designing Android apps.
